Entries.Text: Seperated from @Color:Red@The Military@Clear@ and in fear of being branded a deserter,
Sorry to interupt your aimless wandering,
but I've been looking for someone very special,
and I've got a good feeling about you.
Yes! You're just the person I've been looking for.
I'm sure you know of the woes our @Color:Red@World@Clear@ is facing.
For as long as anyone can remember,
@Color:Red@The Country@Clear@ has been under constant threat of attack by @Color:Red@Villans@Clear@ and @Color:Red@Monsters@Clear@.
Brave troops of @Color:Red@The Military@Clear@ try to fight against threats,
as clergy of @Color:Red@The Church@Clear@ keep the citizens placated.
Spell casters of @Color:Red@The Collage@Clear@ hoard thier research,
while agents of @Color:Red@The Guild@Clear@ deal in the shadows.
But ever since @Color:Red@The Military@Clear@'s humiliating defeat at @Color:Red@The Fort@Clear@ just @Color:Red@Six Years@Clear@ ago,
things have only become more dire.
Now a cunning @Color:Red@Villain@Clear@ has hatched a nefarious scheme to invade @Color:Red@The City@Clear@,
headquarters of @Color:Red@The Collage@Clear@ and one of this land's few remaining safe havens.
There's no time to wait for help from @Color:Red@The Capital@Clear@,
but there might still be a chance to warn @Color:Red@The City@Clear@ before the attack begins.
and I have really bad social anxiety.
But before we set out for @Color:Red@The City@Clear@,
I wanna see what I've got to work with.
Let me take peek at your @Color:Blue@Page Book@Clear@.
Your @Color:Blue@Page Book@Clear@ has barely been used.
It's like you've just been wandering aimlessly for the last @Color:Red@Six Years@Clear@.
You didn't forget how to use the @Color:Blue@PAGE@Clear@ System,
then how about a quick demonstration?
These @Color:Red@Squirrels@Clear@ look like they are ready for a fight.
So let's show them what you've got.
I'll give you a quick @Color:Red@Tutorial@Clear@ on the @Color:Blue@PAGE@Clear@ System.
I don't know how much you remember,
so I'll explain like you just @Color:Red@Spawned@Clear@.
the @Color:Blue@PAGE@Clear@ System is an omnipresent all-powerful force that dictates every aspect of our lives.
living creature, or undead, or construct, or...
thing that moves on it's own
meaning to interact with anything in @Color:Red@The World@Clear@,
Normally it's impolite to whip it out in public,
But the text wouldn't be blue if these were normal pages.
These @Color:Blue@Pages@Clear@ define who you are and what you do.
Every @Color:Blue@PageBook@Clear@ has a set number of @Color:Blue@Page Slots@Clear@.
These @Color:Blue@Slots@Clear@ can each hold one @Color:Blue@Page@Clear@ of a specific type.
but I'll come back to that.
The first @Color:Blue@Page@Clear@ of every @Color:Blue@PageBook@Clear@ is the @Color:Blue@Title Page@Clear@.
Let's take a look at yours.
which is nerd speak for how you grow stronger.
It also grants access to some resticted @Color:Blue@Pages@Clear@ that can only be used by @Color:Red@Actors@Clear@ with specific @Color:Blue@Titles@Clear@ .
your @Color:Blue@Title@Clear@ is what makes you you.
After your @Color:Blue@Title Page@Clear@ comes @Color:Blue@Slots@Clear@ for your
@Color:Blue@Passive Page@Clear@ go in the @Color:Blue@Slots@Clear@ with a notch in the corner.
They grant @Color:Red@Effects@Clear@ so long as they are in your @Color:Blue@PageBook@Clear@.
even change what @Color:Red@Equipment@Clear@ you can use.
They are the @Color:Red@Actions@Clear@ you can take in @Color:Red@Combat@Clear@.
when one @Color:Red@Actor@Clear@ becomes hostile towards another,
and things becomes a lot more restrictive.
All @Color:Red@Actors@Clear@ in the area are forced to move in @Color:Red@Turns@Clear@,
and can only preform @Color:Red@Actions@Clear@ by using @Color:Blue@Action Pages@Clear@.
create miracles, lay curses, teleport, shoot guns,

shapeshift, summon minions, levy taxes, teleport, oh wait I said that one, buff allies, cull the weak, consume souls, take drugs, make it rain, turn back time, smell what the rock is cooking, contemplate life, kill god, be sexy, do kung fu fighting, call some lightning, punch ghost, dig a hole, throw bombs, play with fire, commune with spirits, create earthquakes, analyze enemies, brew potions, heal the sick, raise the dead, command beast, sing, dance,
you have to have a @Color:Blue@Action Pages@Clear@ to do it.
You'll find new @Color:Blue@Pages@Clear@ and @Color:Blue@PageBooks@Clear@ as we travel,
but for now let's try out the ones you have.
But I'm assuming you know how to put on clothes.
You can take a closer look after we set up @Color:Red@Camp@Clear@.
For now, let's have a practical demonstration?
They'll make a nice subsitute for @Color:Red@Enemy Actors@Clear@.
just close your eyes and think hostile thoughts towards the @Color:Red@Mushrooms@Clear@.
Now let's cover how to actually use the @Color:Blue@PAGE@Clear@ System.
Start by imagining you're looking down on @Color:Red@The World@Clear@ through a magical window called @Color:Blue@The Screen@Clear@.
hold on, I think I have some @Color:Red@Flash Cards@Clear@ for this
Try using the @Color:Blue@PAGE@Clear@ System to walk over to the @Color:Red@Mushroom@Clear@.
Click the @Color:Blue@Page@Clear@ to add them to your @Color:Blue@PageQue@Clear@.
I'm sure what every you're trying to do is perfectly valid.
But we have to get through this @Color:Red@Tutorial@Clear@.
then you can do your own thing.
Are you having trouble with the inputs? Or are you just checking to see if I have funny things to say?
Because it's not like I have the time to come up with a bunch of responces for someone choosing to fail a tutorial.
There's a whole epic quest to get to, and a world full of people and creatures to see. A bit like this would just be a horrible waste of my time.
So can you please just follow the script and we'll get on with the quest?

You have 6 Action Pages and a PPR of 4. That 1,296 unique permutations for your first Round. It will take at least 2 Rounds to reach the mushroom, so 1,296 squared is 1,679,616 possible paths I'd have to account for.
I have the power to send you back to the Main Menu. This is your last warning.
Now hit @Color:Blue@Start@Clear@ to see the @Color:Blue@PAGE@Clear@ System in action!
To attack the @Color:Red@Mushroom@Clear@, you'll need to move so that it's in your @Color:Red@Target Range@Clear@.
I've got a @Color:Red@Flash Card@Clear@ for that too.
Click the @Color:Blue@Page@Clear@ to add them to your @Color:Blue@PageQue@Clear@.
The legend of the @Color:Red@Mushroom@Clear@ Slayer is born!
Oh, and it looks like the it dropped an @Color:Red@Item@Clear@.
Now, see the @Color:Red@Mushroom@Clear@ on the Roof?
You won't be able to reach it with a @Color:Red@Weapon Attack@Clear@,
so let's learn about @Color:Red@Missiles@Clear@ by throwing a rock at it.
A @Color:Red@Missiles@Clear@ is any projectile that is created by a @Color:Blue@Page@Clear@ .
This includes arrows, fireballs, rocks, stuff like that.
I'm replacing your @Color:Red@Basic Weapon Attack@Clear@  with a @Color:Red@Chuck-A-Rock@Clear@ Page, but I'm just letting you borrow it!
You have to give it back.
Click the @Color:Blue@Page@Clear@ to add them to your @Color:Blue@PageQue@Clear@.
Great! Now we'll start the turn and when the Targeting UI comes up, just select the spot with the mushroom in it.
You just had to click on the mushroom!
Well, thanks for wasting my rock I guess,
At least you got the basics of how Missiles work. I'm giving you back your Basic Weapon Attack, but you still owe me a rock.
Now no mushroom can escape your wrath!
You can have your Basic Weapon Attack back, and thank you for keeping good care of my rock.
Your final lesson is by far the most important
Something that you MUST know before going into combat
So, it would be seriously bad if if I was inter-
Nevermind what I was just saying.
We've got Squirrels, and they're ready to fight.
I guess it's time for your first live combat exercise.
Oh, and if you feel bad about beating up cute woodland critters, don't worry.
These squirrels are radical political extremists whos views are the exact opposite of whatever you belive in.
Also, they are trying to kill you.
This is a good chance to talk about
how the Round works when multiple Actors are on the field.
Actors can have a different number of actions per turn. I think I've got a flash-
There's more of them than I though.
Looks like they are wearing heavy Armor, so you'll want to-
you take the rest of the Flash Cards,
and I'll wait in the safty of this cabin.
But, don't think the tutorial is over yet!
Since the squirrels seem to be dealt with, let's set up camp here and take a look at your PageBook.
